title: PoA Legal Grounding (leg) Claim
description: Schema for the 'leg' claim in a Proof-of-Authorization (PoA) mandate, defining legal grounding, jurisdiction, accountable party, and approval references.

jurisdiction.description: Legal jurisdiction governing this mandate (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or 'GLOBAL').

accountable_party.description: The human or organizational entity legally accountable for the action.

id.description: Unique identifier (e.g., UPN, employee ID, service account name).

approval_ref.description: Reference to an external approval record (e.g., ServiceNow ticket, Jira issue, UUID of approval workflow).

required.description: Whether dual control was required for this mandate.

approver.description: The second approver who authorized this mandate.

approved_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when dual-control approval was granted.

regulation_refs.description: List of regulatory frameworks this mandate helps satisfy.

retention_days.description: Minimum number of days the audit record for this mandate must be retained.
